title: Trains delayed along coastal line
byline: Train services on the coastal line have been delayed due to a mound of earth collapsing on to the railway tracks in the Magalkanda area of Beruwala, the Department of Railways announced.

title: Trump says Gaza war has ended; Israel awaits release of hostages
byline: The war in Gaza has ended and the Middle East is going to “normalize,” U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday as he flew to Israel, which was waiting for Hamas to release Israeli hostages as world leaders were gathering to discuss the next steps toward peace.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern and Northwestern provinces and in Mannar district, today (13), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Foreign remittances reach $695 million in September
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has stated that Sri Lankan migrant workers sent a total of US $695.7 million in remittances to the country in September this year.

title: Police seek to arrest senior attorney over incident at Mount Lavinia court premises
byline: Police officers have visited the residence of the senior attorney connected to the incident in which a police officer allegedly assaulted an attorney within the Mount Lavinia court premises, in order to arrest him.

title: Two killed in separate road accidents
byline: Two individuals have died in separate road accidents reported in Pooneryn and Hungama areas yesterday (12), police stated.

title: In bid to save shipyards, US set to charge fees on Chinese ships
byline: An escalating trade war between China and the United States faces another flashpoint on Tuesday (Oct 14) when Chinese ships will be required to start paying a special fee to dock at US ports.

title: 78th session of WHO Regional Committee for South-East Asia begins in Colombo today
byline: The 78th Session of the World Health Organization (WHO) Regional Committee for South-East Asia will be held in Colombo from today (13) to 15 October 2025.

title: PM Harini reaffirms Sri Lanka’s commitment to advancing women’s rights and equality
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that Sri Lanka reaffirms its commitment to advancing the rights and well-being of women and girls, and to translating principles into practical action for equality and dignity.

title: Hamas hands over first seven hostages to Red Cross as part of Gaza ceasefire
byline: Hamas released seven hostages into the custody of the Red Cross on Monday, the first to be released as part of a breakthrough ceasefire after two years of war between Israel and Hamas in the devastated Gaza Strip.

title: Trump arrives in Israel as Hamas begins releasing hostages
byline: US President Donald Trump has touched down in Tel Aviv as the Israel-Hamas ceasefire reached a pivotal point on Monday (Oct 13).

title: Mount Lavinia Police HQI transferred with immediate effect
byline: The Police Headquarters Inspector (HQI) of Mount Lavinia, H.T.M. Thushara, has been transferred with immediate effect.

title: Police officer arrested over Mt. Lavinia court incident granted bail
byline: A Police Constable who was arrested and remanded after allegedly assaulting an attorney within the premises of the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court on Friday (10) has been granted bail, a short while ago.

title: 34-year-old hacked to death by brother in Kurunegala
byline: A person has been hacked to death with a sharp weapon allegedly by his own brother in the Galgamuwa area of Kurunegala.

title: Sri Lanka calls for global investment partnerships ahead of Economic and Investment Summit 2025
byline: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment Arun Hemachandra called for international business and investment partnership to be enabled during the Sri Lanka Economic and Investment Summit 2025 to be held in Colombo in December this year.

title: Hamas publishes names of 20 Israeli hostages to be released
byline: Palestinian group Hamas published on Monday the names of the 20 Israeli hostages to be released under the first phase of a ceasefire agreement with Israel.

title: Fire breaks out at building on Bauddhaloka Mawatha
byline: A fire has broken out at a building located on Bauddhaloka Mawatha in Colombo.

title: 38 buses carrying Palestinian prisoners arrive in Gaza - with all living hostages back in Israel
byline: Hamas has confirmed that the first of 38 buses carrying Palestinian prisoners from Israel has arrived in Gaza.

title: Israel to nominate Donald Trump for Nobel Peace Prize next year
byline: Calling US President Donald Trump the “President of peace”, Israeli Parliament Speaker Amir Ohana today announced that he will rally support across the world to submit Trump’s candidacy for a Nobel Peace Prize next year.

title: BMD certificate system, e-revenue license system and several online government services disrupted due to Lanka Government Cloud outage
byline: Due to a disruption in the Lanka Government Cloud (LGC), several online services managed by various government organizations have been temporarily affected, the Information Communication Technology Agency (ICTA) stated.

title: Ex-President Sirisena questioned for five hours by Bribery Commission
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning (13).

title: All 20 living Israeli hostages released by Hamas
byline: Israeli media say a second group of 13 hostages has been handed over to the Red Cross in southern Gaza and is on its way back to Israel.

title: SC to take up FR filed seeking an order to prevent mineral mining on Mannar Island
byline: The Supreme Court has ordered that a Fundamental Rights petition filed seeking an order to prevent alleged illegal mineral mining on Mannar Island be called on February 10, 2026 for consideration.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu to attend summit in Egypt with Donald Trump
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will attend Monday’s summit on ending the Gaza war in the Egyptian Red Sea resort of Sharm el-Sheikh, an Egyptian presidential spokesperson said.

title: Nobel Prize in Economics awarded to Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt for innovation-driven growth research
byline: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt won the 2025 Nobel economics prize for “having explained innovation-driven economic growth”, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences said on Monday.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: President Trump lands in Egypt for peace summit
byline: United States President Donald Trump landed in Egypt on Monday, where he will attend the Gaza ceasefire summit in the resort town of Sharm el-Sheikh, according to the White House.

title: 42 people killed as bus crashes on mountain road in South Africa
byline: At least 42 people have been killed in a bus crash on a steep mountain road in South Africa, authorities have said.

title: Donald Trump touts ‘dawn of a new Middle East’ in address to Israeli parliament
byline: US President Donald Trump has told cheering Israeli lawmakers that “this is the historic dawn of a new Middle East”, after helping to broker a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza.

title: New Secretary appointed to Ministry of Housing, Construction and Water Supply
byline: Kumudu Lal Bogahawatta has been appointed as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Housing, Construction, and Water Supply.

title: Netanyahu nominates Israel’s ‘greatest friend’ Donald Trump for country’s highest award
byline: Benjamin Netanyahu has confirmed that he has submitted Donald Trump’s nomination to be the first non-Israeli recipient of the Israel Prize - the country’s highest award.

title: 45 arrested by Navy for engaging in illegal fishing activities
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has apprehended 45 individuals involved in illegal fishing practices during a series of operations conducted between September 29 and October 7, 2025.

title: Three vendors fined by Ratnapura and Matugama courts for selling goods at inflated prices
byline: Three vendors who pleaded guilty to selling goods at inflated prices have been fined today (13) by the Ratnapura and Matugama Magistrate Courts.

title: Health Minister elected chair of WHO’s 78th South-East Asia Regional Committee session
byline: The 78th session of the World Health Organization’s (WHO) Regional Committee for South-East Asia got underway in Colombo today, with Minister of Health Nalinda Jayatissa elected as chairman for a one-year term.

title: PM Harini meets China’s top political advisor in Beijing
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya, who is in Beijing for the Global Leaders’ Meeting on Women has held discussions with China’s top political advisor Wang Huning today (13).

title: SC rules police violated fundamental rights of bus owner by unlawfully arresting him
byline: The Supreme Court has ruled that a group of six police officers, including the former Officer-in-Charge of the Kottawa Police Station, violated the fundamental rights of a private bus owner by unlawfully arresting him without just cause.

title: Development officer in Niyagama arrested for aiding and abetting bribery
byline: A Development Officer attached to the Niyagama Divisional Secretariat has been arrested today (13) by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), on suspicion of aiding and abetting the acceptance of a bribe.

title: Israeli lawmakers display ‘genocide’ poster during Trump’s speech, removed
byline: Two Israeli lawmakers, Ayman Odeh and Ofer Cassif, displayed poster reading ‘genocide’ during US President Donald Trump’s speech at the Knesset, Israel’s Parliament, on Monday.

title: Sri Lanka remains committed to working closely with BIMSTEC: FM
byline: Sri Lanka remains committed to working closely with BIMSTEC to harness the potential of science, technology and innovation for regional prosperity and resilience, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has stated.

title: Govt attaches great importance to relations with China: PM Harini
byline: Sri Lanka-China relations boast a long history and bilateral cooperation has yielded fruitful results, said Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe to represent Sri Lanka at WTO Trade Policy Review in Geneva
byline: Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security, and Cooperative Development Wasantha Samarasinghe is scheduled to attend the World Trade Organization’s (WTO) Trade Policy Review (TPR) of Sri Lanka, as well as the 16th session of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development.

title: President holds special discussion on proposed wage increase for plantation workers
byline: A discussion regarding the proposed wage increase for plantation workers was held this afternoon at the Presidential Secretariat, under the leadership of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, with the participation of representatives from plantation companies.

title: Final decision on electricity tariff revision to be announced tomorrow
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced that the final decision regarding the revision of electricity tariffs will be made public tomorrow (14).

title: Madagascar’s president has left the country after Gen Z protests: Officials
byline: Madagascar’s president has fled the African nation, the head of the opposition and other officials said on Monday (Oct 13), the second time that young protesters have toppled a government in weeks of worldwide Gen Z unrest.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several areas in seven districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued for multiple areas in seven districts as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.
